q_text: Java questions 1. Identify the Error in the Following Code public class Main { static void fun() { static int  x=5 // Error: Java does not allow static local variables x++; System.out.print(x+""); } public static void main(String[] args) { fun(); for (int i=0  i<3; i++) } }
options: Compilation Error - Static local variables not allowed

What Will Be the Output? public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { char ch ='A'; int num =ch+1 System.out.println(num); Options: } }
public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { } } int a= Integer.MIN_VALUE; int b=-1; System.out.println(a/b);

import java.io.File; import java.io.FileNotFoundException; import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner scanner = null; try { scanner = new Scanner(new File("file.txt")); String buffer = scanner.next(); System.out.println(buffer); } catch (FileNotFoundException e) { System.out.println("File not found!"); } finally { if (scanner != null) scanner.close(); } } }
options: Check if file exists before reading

q_text: public class Main { static void recursive Function() { int x=5; recursive Function(); } public static void main(String[] args) { recursive Function(); } }
public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { int[] arr ={1,2,3,4,5} for (int i=0  i<=5 i++) { System.out.print(arr[i] + " "); } } }
public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { float x=0.1f; if (x==0.1f) { System.out.println("Equal"); } else { System.out.println("Not Equal"); } } } A) Equal
public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { int x=5 System.out.printf("%d %d %d", x, x++, ++x); } }
